N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 14 ยง 15.1 - General

State Regulations
(a) This Part
contains regulations governing admission and retention of full-time inpatients
or residents in hospitals, schools and alcoholism facilities, as such terms are
defined in the Mental Hygiene Law. (b) Each patient shall have a preliminary
physical examination upon admission and a comprehensive physical and mental
examination within 48 hours after admission to the facility, excluding weekends
and holidays. In addition, an initial assessment should be made at the time of
admission of those social and economic factors which will impede and those
which will facilitate the patient's discharge and a tentative plan of action
should be formulated. This should include information about the patient's minor
children, their number, age and whereabouts, if applicable, and appropriate
action should be taken if there is a question about their welfare. (c) Except as otherwise provided, patients
and residents may be admitted to facilities only on the forms and in accordance
with the procedures prescribed by the commissioner. Detailed admission
procedures are included in the following manuals issued and periodically
revised for particular groups of facilities by the department. (1)
